item.title: Commoners facing the brunt of winter vegetable price spiral
item.description: Unseasonal early-November rainfall has pushed up winter vegetable prices across Rajshahi, and Sylhet districts piling pressure on consumers already battling against the rising living costs. Our Rajshahi correspondent reports: Untimely downpour in early-November caused extensive damage to winter ve

item.title: Gaibandha farmer makes cattle feed out of banana stems
item.description: GAIBANDHA, Nov 20: A farmer of remote Hazirhat in Sundarganj has been using banana plant's stems, or portions forming the trunk-like structure, to produce a new processed fodder item for cattle, and addressing feed shortage in the area. The fodder from banana stalks are as cost effective as it is

item.title: Three DU students injured after leaping from hall buildings amid quake panic
item.description: Three students of Dhaka University have been injured after they leapt from the three-storey Hajji Muhammad Mohsin Hall and the four-storey Muktijoddha Ziaur Rahman Hall in panic as a strong quake rattled Bangladesh on Friday. A student from Muktijoddha Ziaur Rahman Hall is believed to have broken

item.title: FEAB Foundation holds seminar on food and agribusiness development, innovation
item.description: The FEAB Foundation organised its 7th International Seminar on Thursday (November 20) at the International Convention City Bashundhara (ICCB) in Dhaka to promote food and agribusiness development, safe food production, and technology-driven innovation. The event coincided with the opening of the 13

item.title: Earthquake: Infant dies as wall collapses in Narayanganj
item.description: A 10-month-old infant has been killed after a wall collapsed in a building in Narayanganj’s Rupganj during Friday’s earthquake. Tariqul Islam, chief of Rupganj Police Station, said two other people, including the child’s mother, have been injured in the incident in the Golakandai

item.title: Govt closely monitoring earthquake aftermath in Bangladesh: Chief adviser
item.description: Chief Adviser Prof Muhammad Yunus has said the government is aware of public concern and panic caused by the earthquake that jolted Dhaka and other parts of Bangladesh on Friday morning. In a statement, the Chief Adviser said the situation is being closely monitored, and all relevant departments h

item.title: Vietnam leads ASEAN in consumer optimism: UOB
item.description: Vietnam continues to lead the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) in consumer optimism, supported by a positive economic outlook and confidence in personal finances, Vietnam News Agency reported Friday, citing a study by Singapore-based United Overseas Bank (UOB). Vietnam posted the hig

item.title: Man held over murder of Jubo Dal leader dies in police custody
item.description: A man arrested in connection with the killing of Jubo Dal leader Golam Kibria in Dhaka’s Pallabi has reportedly died while in the custody of the Detective Branch (DB) of police. The Dhaka Metropolitan Police (DMP) said that 40-year-old Moktar Hossain was declared dead at Dhaka Medical Colleg

item.title: Powerful earthquake leaves five dead, scores injured across Bangladesh
item.description: At least five people were killed and scores of others, including children and the elderly, were injured when a 5.7-magnitude earthquake struck Dhaka and several other parts of the country on Friday morning. Thirteen people were injured after the railing of a building collapsed on them in the Kosha

item.title: Hand bombs found on metro rail tracks
item.description: Police have recovered two unexploded hand bombs from the elevated metro rail track near the Kazipara station in Dhaka. The objects were discovered on Friday morning on the flat section of track between pillars No. 288 and 289. Cleaners working in the area spotted the devices around 8:30am on Frid

item.title: CA expresses profound grief over earthquake casualties
item.description: Chief Adviser Professor Muhammad Yunus on Friday expressed profound shock and sorrow at the reports of deaths and injuries in house collapses and other incidents triggered by a powerful earthquake in several districts across the country. In a condolence message released by his Press Wing this afte

item.title: Khaleda to attend Armed Forces Day reception
item.description: BNP Chairperson and former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia will attend the Armed Forces Day reception at Senakunja on Friday afternoon. The BNP chief is scheduled to leave her Gulshan residence for Senakunja around 3pm, said BNP Media Cell member Sayrul Kabir Khan. He said Khaleda’s medical boar
